formal_accuser.name: George Grosjean
formal_accuser.relationship_to_accused: lived in same house 6 years earlier

confession.seduction_date: 11 years before arrest (around 1614), initially said 7 years
confession.seduction_context: Met man on road around Whitsun who showed her sack of gold and silver; another man appeared offering to make her richest of her family if she would serve him; gave her coin which vanished from her pocket

devil_mark.description: Surgeon searched body on 13 August 1625 and found nothing unnatural

sabbat_activities: kissed anus of Devil in form of ox

witnesses.name: George Grosjean
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: lived in same house 6 years earlier

testimony.quarrel_subject: Not invited to supper after childbirth celebration when other women and husbands were invited

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: next day child began to sicken

testimony.threat_quote: vous aurez encore affaire de moy

witnesses.name: Claude Habille
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: family accused her of killing his aunt

testimony.quarrel_subject: Libaire refused to lend Claudon money
Stepdaughter said to Claudon's daughter that her mother had killed hers; Claudon asked witness to punish the girl

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: soon after being asked to punish girl

harms_alleged.target: herself (very ill and out of her mind)

witnesses.name: Janne servante au maire Claude Ulriet

testimony.quarrel_subject: Two quarrels: first refused to give patron de dentelle (lace pattern) saying it was old; second when bringing back linen after washing
testimony.threat_quote: y faict il bon (while pushing her); told her she would repent

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: when she put bundle down on return after second quarrel

testimony.quarrel_subject: Her sister Anne called Claudon and husband sorcerers throughout the town
testimony.threat_quote: veux tu avoir aussy mauvaise langue que ta soeur qui nous appelle sorciers parmy la ville, par les mant dey, sy j'eusse sceu elle n'en eut eschappé à sy bon marché

harms_alleged.target: herself (vomiting strange things like pebbles, pins, and nails)
Libaire (her sister's daughter, also mentioned in witness 7)

witnesses.name: Barbe femme de Jean du Menil

testimony.quarrel_subject: lost towel when washing; Claudon took enquiry as accusation of theft
Daughter Margueritte had said at poisle that she was happy Claudon and husband could not find house, while people of good reputation could

witnesses.name: Margueritte fille de Lucie femme de Nicolas Remy

testimony.quarrel_subject: she had spoken evil of Claudon

witnesses.name: Barbe Sellier veuve de Phillibert Philbert

testimony.quarrel_subject: Claudon's daughter disputed over price of lace with witness's husband

harms_alleged.target: Phillibert Philbert (her husband, fell off horse and died from injuries)

timeline.subject: Claudon Martin
timeline.details: PG des Vosges orders arrest; carried out same day

timeline.subject: Claudon Martin
timeline.details: Second interrogation, pressed about confessions allegedly made in prison

timeline.subject: Claudon Martin
timeline.details: Third interrogation, gave list of herbal remedies

timeline.subject: Claudon Martin
timeline.details: Fourth interrogation, withdrew part of devil meeting confession

timeline.subject: Claudon Martin
timeline.details: Fifth interrogation, reverted to earlier devil story

timeline.subject: Claudon Martin
timeline.details: Confrontations with witnesses, no progress, simple denials

timeline.subject: Claudon Martin
timeline.details: PG des Vosges asks for question ordinaire et extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Claudon Martin
timeline.details: Change de Nancy agrees to torture, surgeon should search for devil's mark

timeline.subject: Claudon Martin
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture; held out long time, finally confessed when racked very severely

timeline.subject: Claudon Martin
timeline.details: Confirmed earlier confessions, added details about sabbat

timeline.subject: Claudon Martin
timeline.details: Confirmed confessions and declared herself ready to die; PG des Vosges asks for death sentence

timeline.subject: Claudon Martin
timeline.details: Change de Nancy confirms death sentence

torture.restrictions: question ordinaire et extraordinaire; body hair to be shaved and nails cut back to quick

accomplices_named.name: Mansuy
accomplices_named.context: Thought she had seen him at sabbat, once 'hospiteur' of Charmes, but not really very certain

accomplices_named.name: wife of the viel bonnetier of Charmes
accomplices_named.context: Thought she saw at sabbat, whose name she did not know (later seems to have withdrawn this)

notable_quotes.speaker: Francoise femme de Nicolas Moynel (witness 2)
notable_quotes.french: vous aurez encore affaire de moy
notable_quotes.english: you will have more to do with me
notable_quotes.context: Threat made during quarrel over payment for washing shirt

notable_quotes.speaker: Anne femme à Remy Paris (witness 8)
notable_quotes.english: Oh the wife of Grand George
notable_quotes.context: What dying husband Remy Couturieux cried out during illness

notable_quotes.speaker: Anne femme à Remy Paris (witness 8)
notable_quotes.french: l'a tousiours tellement crainct que sy elle luy eut demandé la pluspart de ses biens elle ne luy eust reffusé
notable_quotes.english: always so feared her that if she had asked for most of her goods she would not have refused her
notable_quotes.context: Witness describing her fear of Claudon

notable_quotes.speaker: Didier Simon (witness 10)
notable_quotes.french: dittes luy qu'elle ne soit plus à l'advenir sy sotte ny sy arrogante que du passé
notable_quotes.english: tell her not to be so foolish or so arrogant as in the past
notable_quotes.context: What Claudon said after curing his daughter Anne

notable_quotes.speaker: Anne fille de Didier Simon (witness 11)
notable_quotes.context: What Claudon said while pushing Anne by the arm when she was bringing back linen

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudon fille de Didier Simon (witness 12)
notable_quotes.french: veux tu avoir aussy mauvaise langue que ta soeur qui nous appelle sorciers parmy la ville, par les mant dey, sy j'eusse sceu elle n'en eut eschappé à sy bon marché
notable_quotes.english: do you want to have as evil a tongue as your sister who calls us sorcerers throughout the town, by the devil, if I had known she would not have escaped so cheaply
notable_quotes.context: Threat made by Claudon to younger Simon daughter

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudon Martin
notable_quotes.french: et que les uns sont a luy pour l'avarice les autres par luxure, les autres par envie, et aultres pour aultres vices, ce qu'elle a bien appris des predicateurs
notable_quotes.english: and that some are his through avarice, others through lust, others through envy, and others for other vices, which she learned well from preachers
notable_quotes.context: Describing why people become witches during interrogation

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudon Martin (confession under torture)
notable_quotes.french: mais que les pauvres empeschoient le plus souvent telz desseigns a raison dequoy ilz estoient tres bien battus de l'ennemy
notable_quotes.english: but the poor most often prevented such designs, for which reason they were very well beaten by the enemy
notable_quotes.context: Describing sabbat plots against harvests and how the poor prevented them

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudon Martin (confession under torture)
notable_quotes.french: que les riches y estoient les mieulx voulus du maling
notable_quotes.english: that the rich were the best liked by the evil one

relationships.evidence_text: daughter of Claudon Mulnier and Jeannon Jean Busson
spent 8 years as orphan in house of distant relative Claudon Husson
had been living in same house when his wife gave birth
marchand drapier of Charmes, who gave him a lot of employment making up his cloths
Jannon veuve de Jean Estienne portier de la porte Laxin
Anne femme à Remy Paris boulenger de Charmes
death of her first husband, Remy Couturieux
Janne servante au maire Claude Ulriet
Barbe femme de Jean du Menil
Barbe Sellier veuve de Phillibert Philbert

economic_context.details: Claudon complained of poverty and debts left by late husband during interrogation. Witness 1 mentions George Martin's son being injured by Nicolas Poirat, with compensation of 5 francs and 5 aulnes of serge. Multiple payment disputes over healing services (witness 2 over laundry payment, witness 4's wife gave 14 gros instead of franc requested). Witness 16's daughter said she was happy Claudon could not find a house while people of good reputation could.

third_parties.name: George Martin
third_parties.context: Shoemaker who earned living mending shoes in villages, left debts

third_parties.name: Nicolas Poirat
third_parties.context: Merchant draper who gave George Grosjean employment, suffered from gout, injured Claudon's son

third_parties.name: Messire Adam
third_parties.context: Priest at Charmes who diagnosed bewitchment in multiple cases and performed exorcism

third_parties.name: Libaire
third_parties.relationship_to_witness: aunt of witness 7, daughter of Jannon
third_parties.context: Died after refusing to lend Claudon money, mentioned by multiple witnesses

third_parties.name: Remy Couturieux
third_parties.context: Died 5 years earlier, believed Claudon caused death of his first wife

third_parties.name: Claudon Husson
third_parties.context: Claudon spent 8 years as orphan in his house

third_parties.name: Jean Grainel
third_parties.context: Of Essegney, his mother taught Claudon herbal remedies including boeuf St. Martin technique

third_parties.name: Jannon
third_parties.context: Mother of Libaire, died 2 years before trial

extraction_metadata.notes: This is an exceptionally detailed trial record of a folk healer accused of witchcraft. Claudon Martin was a widow who made her living organizing pilgrimages and providing herbal remedies. The trial reveals the ambiguous position of folk healers who both cured and were blamed for illnesses. Key themes: economic marginality, debt disputes, payment conflicts over healing services, social reputation, fear of witchcraft accusations. Confession obtained only under severe torture. Notable for detailed information about healing practices, pilgrimage economy, and Claudon's confession about sabbat hierarchy favoring the rich and beating the poor who opposed harm to harvests. 19 witnesses testified over two sessions. Trial lasted 70 days from informations to sentence.
